uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class GeoGraphics

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoGraphics
public class GeoGraphics
extends java.lang.Object

The GeoGraphics class is a wrapper for a standard awt.Graphics object that also conains all of the style, filtering and scaleing objects needed by a layer to paint itself.

GeoGraphics are passed to Layers by theme to the paintScaled(GeoGraphics gg) methiod.

Origionaly, layers used a paintScaled(Graphics g, Scaler s, Style st...) method
however, each additional item required a re-write of the Layer interface.

By passing a GeoGraphics object, additonal features can be added more easely.

Since:
0.6
Version:
0.7.1 12/Jan/00
Author:
James Macgill

Field Summary
protected  GeoData data
          contains id/value information that can be used for passing to the shader
protected  Filter filter
          When not null, layers should check against the filter to see if each feature should actualy be drawn by passing the filter its id.
protected  java.awt.Graphics graphics
          A standard awt.Graphics object.
protected  int reason
          Layers can be passed a reason code to tell them why they have to repaint at the moment there is only one reason, 0, but this may be used for further expantion
protected  Scaler scale
          Provides scaling services to match the view that this layer will be drawn in.
protected  Shader shade
          will process value/colour lookups for the layer.
protected  ShadeStyle style
          Contains info on filling, outlining and the like
protected  int width
          Used to store the stroke width for lines.

Constructor Detail

GeoGraphics

public GeoGraphics()
Default constructor, not acutaly of much use to anyone.

GeoGraphics

public GeoGraphics(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   Scaler scale,
                   Shader shade,
                   GeoData data,
                   ShadeStyle style,
                   Filter filter,
                   int reason)
A full constructor for a GeoGraphics object.
Parameters:
g - A standard awt.Graphics object, where the painting should take palce
scale - Used to convert GeoPoints into screen coordinates for the viewer
shade - Provides value/colour lookup for layers
data - Provides id/value lookup for representing data.
style - Contains information on filling and outlineing.
filter - Provides id/visible lookup for filtering out features
reason - A reason code for why a redraw is needed, not used at present.
Method Detail

getReason

public int getReason()
Find out why this GeoGraphics was created not used at present, but may be used for future expantion
Returns:
reason an int value that marks the code for the reason, not used yet.

getGraphics

public java.awt.Graphics getGraphics()
Get the awt.Graphics object so that some painting can actualy be done.
This will tipicaly give you inderict access to the Viewers display.
The graphics object will actualy be to some form of offscreen buffer, because of this there is no need for users to implement any form of buffering themselves.
Returns:
Graphics An awt Graphics object that can be drawn to as normal.

setGraphics

public void setGraphics(java.awt.Graphics g)
Change the graphics object contained by this object. Probaly not needed, as it would be better to create a new GeoGraphics object instead.

setReason

public void setReason(int propValue)

getStyle

public ShadeStyle getStyle()
Get the style object so that info on filling, outlining can be obtained.
Returns:
ShadeStyle the Style object.

setStyle

public void setStyle(ShadeStyle propValue)

getData

public GeoData getData()
Get the data which should be used in this display
Returns:
GeoData A GeoData object against which id/value lookups should be performed.

setData

public void setData(GeoData propValue)

getShade

public Shader getShade()
Any value/colour lookups should be performed by passing them through the Shader object provided by this method.
Returns:
Shader the Shader object to perform value/colour lookups against.

setShade

public void setShade(Shader propValue)

getScale

public Scaler getScale()
Any geographic coordinates can be converted into screen coordiates apropreate for the Graphics object by using the functions provied by the scaler that is returned by this mehtod.
Returns:
Scaler for performing scaleing operations.

setScale

public void setScale(Scaler propValue)

setFilter

public void setFilter(Filter f)

getFilter

public Filter getFilter()
Filters allow featutres to be 'switched off' by id. By passing the id of any feature to the filter provided by this method, layers can check what features should be filtered out.
Returns:
Filter N.B. can be null, in which case no filtering should be performed.
